intro: Gnaphalium artemisiifolium, commonly known as rough hairgrass, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has finely divided, grass-like leaves and produces copious amounts of tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in wet meadows, marshes, and along streambanks. Gnaphalium artemisiifolium is an important component of wetland ecosystems, providing habitat and food for various insects and wildlife.
